summary: SVV infection can cause vesicular lesions clinically indistinguishable from those caused by other vesicular disease viruses, such as foot-and-mouth disease virus (FMDV), swine vesicular disease virus (SVDV), vesicular stomatitis virus (VSV), and vesicular exanthema of swine virus (VESV) the 125 samples were tested by the tacoTM mini extraction/RT-iiPCR and by the tacoTM mini/rRT-iiPCR system in parallel. two samples were positive by the magMAXTM/rRT-PCR system but negative by the tacoTM mini/RT-iiPCR system. the two samples with discrepant results had relatively high CT values.
